shortlist.name: Circle Of Magic (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 4th and 3rd, indicating progression and reliability. Top connections with James Doyle riding for Archie Watson. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest the horse is expected to win if repeating recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Haayimm (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debutant from a respected yard, well found in the market as clear second choice. Lack of form is a question, but the market support and connections imply readiness and ability. Only realistic alternative to the favourite based on odds and profile.

shortlist.name: Ironwill (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive with a win and a place in last two starts, indicating peak condition. Jockey and trainer are reliable, and odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections have a solid record at this level.

shortlist.name: Kody B (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a runner-up finish last time out. Market support is notable, and the horse is proven at this class. Jockey/trainer combination is respected locally.

shortlist.name: Westgate Warrior
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 5.2 exchange (market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a solid 3rd last time after a slow start to the season. Market support is strong, and the recent improvement suggests readiness. Connections are capable at this level. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Bern Rossetti
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this grade with several respectable efforts this season. Trainer and jockey are reliable at Beverley. Form is steady and competitive for this field, and odds are fair for the profile.

shortlist.name: Larchill Lass
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in similar company and is holding form. Connections are in decent form, and the odds reflect realistic winning chances without needing a big leap in performance.

shortlist.name: Democracy Dilemma (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a win last time out, showing a return to peak form after a mixed campaign. Has winning experience at this level and the market support is strong, suggesting confidence from connections. Jockey and trainer both have solid records with sprinters.

shortlist.name: Coto De Caza (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with multiple wins and a respectable reappearance run. Top jockey booked and the Crisford team is in good form. Should strip fitter for latest run and rates a major threat on previous form.

shortlist.name: Powerful Glory (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.3 exchange (solid third choice, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and unbeaten as a juvenile, only defeat came on seasonal return which can be forgiven. Trainer excels with this type and the horse is open to further improvement. Odds reflect genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: One Night Thunder
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 4.9 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, showing clear progression and adaptability. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No sign of regression and profile fits a typical winner at this level.

shortlist.name: A War Eagle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with a string of placed efforts and a recent win, suggesting reliability and readiness. Connections are in good form and the horse is proven at this level. Odds reflect strong win prospects without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Pink Azalea (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/2 SBK, 9 exchange (third in market, some value at current price)
shortlist.rationale: Has won two of last three starts, indicating upward trajectory and ability to win in this grade. Slightly bigger odds than the top two but recent form is compelling. Connections are respected and the horse is unlikely to need major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Charming Fellow
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.9 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and placed efforts in last six starts. Trainer Peter Chapple-Hyam is respected at this level. Current odds indicate strong market support, suggesting confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Law Degree (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5 exchange (solidly in the market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in competitive handicaps and is trained by Tim Easterby, who is adept at placing horses at Beverley. Recent form suggests reliability and ability to compete at this level.

shortlist.name: Echo Of Glory (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several placed efforts, indicating competitiveness. The Kubler team is in good form and the jockey booking is positive. Odds reflect genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Hibernate (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive runner-up finishes and a win two starts back. Proven at this level, holding form well, and represents a top yard. Odds reflect strong market confidence and reliability.

shortlist.name: Mystical Maria
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 7/2 SBK, 5 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and placed last time, indicating current form and ability to compete at this level. Trained by a respected handler and not exposed as needing major improvement. Odds are fair for a likely contender.

shortlist.name: Dandy's Angel (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win within last six starts and competitive efforts in similar company. Consistent enough to warrant shortlist inclusion, with market support suggesting connections expect a good run.

shortlist.name: Master Vintner (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a place from two starts, representing a top yard in excellent form. Rossa Ryan is a reliable jockey booking. The horse is clear favourite on both sportsbook and exchange, indicating strong market confidence and little need for improvement to win again.

shortlist.name: Gold Penny
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with two consecutive third-place finishes, trained by the Gosdens and ridden by Havlin, both highly respected at this level. She is the only realistic alternative to the favourite based on current odds and form, and should be suited by the likely race conditions.

shortlist.name: Birthday Angel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.3 exchange (solid market support, clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with four consecutive fourth-place finishes in competitive handicaps, indicating reliability and ability to hold form. Drops in class and retains a strong, in-form jockey. Odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Al Shabab (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly runs well in similar company and has placed multiple times this season. Recent third and fifth suggest he remains competitive. Rossa Ryan is a positive jockey booking. Odds indicate respect from the market and he does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Dors Delight
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 9.6 exchange (market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last time out) and has shown progressive form through the summer. Versatile and proven at the trip. Connections are capable at this level. Odds are fair for a last-time winner stepping up in class.

shortlist.name: Riffa Spirit (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.5 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out and lightly raced, suggesting scope for further improvement. Connections are strong, and current odds indicate solid market support. Recent win shows ability to handle current grade and conditions.

shortlist.name: Portacloy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improving form figures and a win two starts ago. Consistent and reliable, with a top young jockey booked. Odds reflect strong chance and market respect.

shortlist.name: Star Of Albion
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.1 exchange (firmly in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form and top jockey engagement. Has been running consistently in similar company and looks ready to win. Odds are competitive, indicating market confidence.

shortlist.name: Indian Spirit (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame, trained by an in-form yard, and partnered by a capable jockey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse has shown ability at this level. No major improvement needed to win here.

shortlist.name: Redbud Sixteen (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Improved sharply last time out to finish second, suggesting progression. Rossa Ryan is a positive jockey booking and the odds indicate market respect. Form is competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Nutmeg (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level, with a recent fourth not far off the principals. David Egan is a strong jockey and the trainer is capable. Odds suggest clear third pick, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Return To Unit
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top yard (Varian) and is the clear market favourite, indicating strong confidence. Although only seventh on debut, that run was likely educational and improvement is expected. Jockey booking is positive and the horse is not opposed by any proven winners in the field.

shortlist.name: Panelli
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level with multiple placed efforts this season. Trainer is in good form and the jockey is highly capable. Has the best exposed form in the field and is well found in the market, suggesting reliability for a strong run.

shortlist.name: El Rehaiby (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Well-bred newcomer from a respected stable with a top jockey booked. Market support is notable for a debutant, and connections are capable of readying one first time out. Worth including given lack of depth among exposed rivals.

shortlist.name: Run With It (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.7 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, progressive profile, and top connections. Rossa Ryan is a reliable jockey and Ralph Beckett is in strong form. The odds reflect confidence and the recent form is the best in the field.

shortlist.name: City Of Poets (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 5.5 exchange (solid value, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with two wins and a second from last four starts, suggesting upside. The sixth last time can be forgiven given prior consistency. Billy Loughnane is a capable young jockey and James Tate’s runners are often well-prepared.

shortlist.name: Cavolo Nero
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 5.2 exchange (well respected in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, with multiple placings and a win in recent form. Tom Marquand is a top jockey and the horse’s profile suggests reliability and competitiveness in this grade.

shortlist.name: Recon Mission (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a recent win and several solid runs. Odds indicate strong market confidence. Trainer is adept with sprinters at this track. No sign of major decline in form.

shortlist.name: Rift Valley (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Bookmaker favorite (2/1), exchange price (4.0) suggests some caution.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive races, often finishing close up. Top jockey booking and strong connections. Market support is notable, and form is reliable for this grade.

shortlist.name: Triggered (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive handicaps, regularly finishing in the frame. Billy Loughnane is a reliable, in-form jockey. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value for a runner with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Jackson Street (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Current market favourite with competitive odds. Recent form shows consistent midfield finishes, suggesting readiness to peak. Trainer has a good record at Lingfield, and the horse is well placed to improve with conditions likely to suit.

shortlist.name: Francisco
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several placed efforts, indicating ability at this level. Connections are respected, and odds suggest market support. Has shown versatility and consistency, making him a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Elvetham (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 (SBK), 5.3 (exchange) – solid market position, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with four consecutive runner-up finishes suggests the horse is in peak condition and knocking on the door for a win. The odds reflect strong market support, and the connections are reliable. No signs of regression in the form cycle.

shortlist.name: Birkie Boy (Ire)
shortlist.trainer: Miss Celine De La Haye, Jersey
shortlist.odds_note: 18/1 (SBK), 3.1 (exchange) – significant exchange support, ignore SBK outlier
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and a solid run of placed efforts prior. The exchange market shows this runner is well-fancied despite a higher fixed-odds quote, indicating strong professional support. Jockey is capable and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Takteek
shortlist.rationale: Recent third suggests improvement and the booking of Rossa Ryan is a positive. The horse has been running consistently in competitive handicaps and is now dropping to a winnable mark. Connections are respected and the odds are fair for the profile.

shortlist.name: Night Tara (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, having won two of last three starts and finishing second in the other. The combination of a top trainer and reliable jockey further boosts confidence. Odds are short but justified by recent consistency and class edge over this field.

shortlist.name: Eagle One
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid placed efforts and a recent runner-up finish after a break, indicating fitness. Connections are respected and the horse is well clear of outsiders on both form and odds. Represents the only realistic threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Squadron Leader (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, indicating improvement and readiness. Hollie Doyle is a top jockey, and Archie Watson is a respected trainer. The odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest this runner is expected to be highly competitive.

shortlist.name: Kilkenny Warrior (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for improvement; Richard Hughes is a shrewd trainer. The horse is well-supported in the market, suggesting connections expect a forward showing. Recent form is less exposed but the odds indicate respect.

shortlist.name: Houdini Miss (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/1 (SBK), 4.3 (exchange) – exchange price much shorter than fixed odds
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two seconds in last four starts. The significant discrepancy between exchange and bookmaker odds suggests strong support from informed money. Connections are capable and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Aleen
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 (SBK), 3.8 (exchange) – clear market leader after withdrawn favourite
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improving form figures, placed last two starts, and now faces a weaker field after the withdrawal of the odds-on favourite. Represents a top trainer known for improving types, and has a strong jockey booking. Odds are fair for a likely winner in this context.

shortlist.name: Halla Bil Zain (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 (SBK), 4 (exchange) – solid second choice in the market
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two placings in last three starts, suggesting reliability at this level. Trainer and jockey combination is respected. Has shown ability to handle similar company and is well positioned to capitalize if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Marwaan
shortlist.rationale: Latest win two starts ago shows clear ability and recent improvement. Although less exposed than others, the upward trajectory and market support make this runner a legitimate contender if building on last win.

shortlist.name: Celestias Comet (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Trained by James Fanshawe, a respected handler, and market support is strong. No sign of regression in form and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Cotiere (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a solid second last time out. Trained by Ralph Beckett, who excels with improving types. Form suggests further improvement is likely and odds are competitive for a leading chance.

shortlist.name: Sundaysunrise
shortlist.rationale: Debutant from the Gosden yard with Daniel Tudhope booked, indicating intent. Market support is notable and connections are top-class. While unraced, the profile and odds suggest significant ability and readiness.

shortlist.name: Miraculous (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last 6 starts. Trained by Roger Varian, a top yard, and partnered by a reliable jockey. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and form is holding up well against this field.

shortlist.name: Alligator Alley
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and readiness. Market support is strong, suggesting confidence from punters. Trainer Ruth Carr is in good form and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Muker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several placed efforts, showing competitive ability. Odds are fair for a horse with proven class and the trainer is adept with sprinters. Muker has shown versatility and should be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Star Of Mali (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a close second last time. Proven ability at this level, representing a strong yard with a reliable jockey. Current odds reflect market confidence and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Leading Times
shortlist.rationale: Well-supported in the market despite lacking public form, indicating strong stable confidence and potential. Trained by Roger Varian, whose runners are often well-prepared for debut efforts at this level.

shortlist.name: Playtime
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out, suggesting peak fitness. Trained by Andrew Balding, a reliable yard, and partnered by an experienced jockey. Odds indicate strong market confidence and recent form is progressive, with no signs of regression.

shortlist.name: Ribble Vibe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive races, regularly placing and running well. David O'Meara is a respected trainer and Daniel Tudhope is a strong jockey booking. Odds reflect solid market support and the horse has shown ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Tryfan
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 4.6 exchange (firmly in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and competitive efforts since. Hector Crouch is in good recent form as a jockey, and the horse has shown ability to win at this level. Market position suggests connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: Both Of Us (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/4 SBK, 2.48 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time, suggesting peak fitness and improvement. George Boughey is a respected trainer and the odds reflect strong confidence. Recent win and consistent connections make this the most likely winner.

shortlist.name: Infantry Officer
shortlist.rationale: Has two wins this season and remains competitive in recent starts. Michael Bell is a capable trainer and Hector Crouch is a reliable jockey. Form is solid for this grade and odds are fair for a contender.

shortlist.name: Hobie (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 3.3 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, suggesting clear improvement and fitness. Connections are in good order, and the market strongly supports his chance. No signs of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Gone In Sixty
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid second choice, well clear of outsiders)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive races, regularly finishing in the frame. Odds reflect strong market respect and the horse is proven at this level. No evidence of needing major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: John Barbour
shortlist.odds_note: 4/7 SBK, 1.7 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and places in recent form, trained by an in-form yard and partnered by a reliable jockey. The odds reflect strong confidence and he sets the standard on recent achievements. No sign of decline in form and connections are highly respected.

shortlist.name: Soleil D'arizona (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win and placed efforts, trained and ridden by the top Skelton team. Consistent at this level and offers value as the main threat to the favourite. No major negatives in form or connections.

shortlist.name: Beau Quali (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 2.9 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with multiple placings and a strong trainer-jockey combination. Recent form is solid, and the market has him as a clear favourite, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No signs of decline in form and proven at the trip.

shortlist.name: Hamlet's Night (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and progressive profile, winning last time out and runner-up on debut. The form suggests improvement and the current odds reflect strong market respect. Jockey and trainer both in good form, making this runner a key threat.

shortlist.name: Belle Montrose (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support; 85/40 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear favourite).
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time out, indicating peak form. Recent improvement and consistency in the placings suggest readiness for another big run. Connections have placed the horse well and market confidence is notable.

shortlist.name: Window Of Time (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a strong second last time. Trained by Olly Murphy and ridden by Sean Bowen, both respected in the sphere. Profile suggests reliability and ability to handle conditions.

shortlist.name: Sail Away (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out, indicating readiness and peak fitness. Top connections with Skelton team, who excel at Warwick. Recent form is solid and odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Ile De Jersey (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two places in last four starts. Trained by Henderson, a proven operator at this level. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with reliable form and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Jubilant (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/5 SBK, 2.96 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins from last three starts, including a recent victory. Proven consistency at this level and retains top jockey Sean Bowen. Odds reflect strong confidence and connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: Bumpy Evans (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with four consecutive wins before a fall last time, suggesting untapped potential if none the worse for that mishap. Trainer excels with similar types and market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Deep Purple (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5 exchange (third in market, respected connections)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, regularly hitting the frame. Top-class jockey/trainer combination. Recent form is solid and competitive, suggesting a reliable run is likely.

shortlist.name: Ri Na Cuirte (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a runner-up finish last time and a reliable profile over similar trips. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: My Gift To You (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and generally consistent placings. Trainer and jockey have shown good synergy. Form suggests the horse is holding condition and competitive at this grade.

shortlist.name: Belles Benefit (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Latest run was a win, indicating peak form. Connections are respected and the horse has shown improvement through the season. Odds are competitive and reflect genuine winning prospects.

shortlist.name: Straight Up (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Represents the top yard of Aidan O'Brien and is partnered by a leading jockey. The horse is well found in the market as favourite, indicating strong expectations from connections and punters. Lack of form figures suggests a debut or unexposed profile, which is typical for a well-bred O'Brien runner at this meeting. Market confidence and connections are key positives.

shortlist.name: Perisher (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.55 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability with a second-place finish on debut, followed by a fifth. Trained by Joseph O'Brien, who is adept with juveniles, and ridden by a top jockey. The horse is prominent in the betting, suggesting connections and punters expect improvement. Form is competitive for this level.

shortlist.name: Spectical (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 5.1 exchange (third in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Finished fifth on debut, which can be upgraded given the likely improvement second time out. Oisin Murphy is a top jockey booking, and Jessica Harrington is a respected trainer. Market position suggests the horse is expected to progress and be competitive.

shortlist.name: Liamo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in strong form with two recent third-place finishes following a win, indicating consistency and peak fitness. Market support is significant, and connections are respected. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Alex Belardo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and a win in the last six starts. Recent form figures suggest reliability and competitiveness at this level. Trainer and jockey combination is capable.

shortlist.name: Facethepuckout (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 5.0 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, recent form figures show regular competitiveness in similar handicaps. Top jockey booking (C. T. Keane) is a notable positive, and trainer is respected. Odds indicate strong market confidence without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Highbury See See (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in excellent form with three consecutive placed efforts after a win earlier in the campaign. Profile suggests reliability and current peak. Odds are notably short, indicating strong support and expectation of another big run.

shortlist.name: Ramiro (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 5.2 exchange (market positive, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Classy performer at best, now with a top international jockey in Oisin Murphy. Recent form is below best but has excuses and is well treated on old form. Market support suggests connections expect a return to form.

shortlist.name: Norwalk Havoc
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, recent form suggests fitness and ability to win in this grade. Top connections and strong market support indicate high confidence.

shortlist.name: Cristal Clere (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/1 SBK, 3.15 exchange (exchange price much shorter than fixed odds, indicating smart money)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer, exchange market suggests much stronger chance than fixed odds imply. Solid recent form and reliable connections.

shortlist.name: Mataariki (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Has won this season and remains competitive in similar company. Trainer in form, exchange market support notable.

shortlist.name: Limestone (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close 3rd and 2nd, representing a top trainer. Current odds indicate strong market support and suggest the horse is expected to be competitive. Connections are reliable and the horse is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Red Autumn (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and a close 2nd, showing improvement and consistency. Trainer is highly respected and the odds reflect strong market confidence. The horse is proven at this level and distance.

shortlist.name: Extravagant (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts, trained by a leading yard. The horse has shown ability to win and place consistently, and the odds suggest genuine market respect. Connections and form profile are both strong.

shortlist.name: Vega's Muse
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 3.55 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in strong form, having won last time out and placed consistently prior. Connections are respected at this level, and current odds reflect strong market support. No need for major improvement based on recent performances.

shortlist.name: Midnight Strike (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 2.8 exchange (not an outsider, exchange price notably strong)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with back-to-back thirds, and exchange market support is significant. Top connections (O'Brien/McMonagle) add confidence. No evidence of needing major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: On A Session (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market position, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with a top-class jockey booked. Form is solid and connections are capable. Odds indicate market respect and no major improvement required to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Saratoga (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and a top-class trainer. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse is peaking at the right time. Connections are highly reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Bryant (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and solid placed efforts indicate improving form. Jockey is in good form and the odds suggest genuine market support. Connections have a strong record with progressive types.

shortlist.name: Delta
shortlist.rationale: Latest win signals readiness and upward trajectory. Top jockey booking adds further appeal. Trainer excels with improving horses and the odds are competitive for a horse with recent winning form.

shortlist.name: Lexington Du Seuil (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent connections; typically well-supported in the market at Auteuil.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading French jumps yard with a strong record at Auteuil. Jockey Clement Lefebvre is a notable booking for this stable, often used for their best chances. While form is not listed, the combination of trainer and jockey suggests this runner is likely to be well-prepared and competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Cocotte Royale (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Y. Fouin-trained runners are rarely overlooked in the market at this venue.
shortlist.rationale: Y. Fouin is a prolific trainer at Auteuil, and his runners are consistently competitive in these types of races. Simon Planque is a capable jockey with a good strike rate for the yard. Even without published form, the connections alone make this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Prince De Grez (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Chaille-Chaille runners are typically well-fancied in Parisian jumps races.
shortlist.rationale: The Chaille-Chaille team is highly respected in French National Hunt racing, especially at Auteuil. Their runners are usually well-schooled and ready to perform, and Charlotte Prichard is a competent rider for the yard. Market support is likely, making this a logical inclusion.

shortlist.name: Andre As (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on top jockey booking and trainer profile.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a leading jockey in France, and Mathieu Pitart is a respected trainer at Auteuil. This combination often signals strong intent, especially in competitive fields. With no negative form indicators and likely to be well found in the market, Andre As (Fr) stands out on connections and expected market support.

shortlist.name: Canndarian (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Y. Fouin-trained runners are typically well supported at Auteuil and rarely go off at big prices.
shortlist.rationale: Y. Fouin is one of the most successful trainers at Auteuil, and Simon Planque is a capable jockey with a good strike rate for the yard. Even without published recent form, the stable's record and typical market respect make Canndarian (Fr) a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Heart And Soul (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Bryony Frost is a high-profile jockey, suggesting market confidence and a competitive chance.
shortlist.rationale: The booking of Bryony Frost, an internationally recognized jockey, is notable for a French race and often indicates a horse with a genuine winning chance. The trainer has a solid local record, and such a jockey booking is rarely wasted on outsiders.

shortlist.name: Diamant Du Rheu (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders given top connections and typical market support for Nicolle runners at Auteuil.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Francois Nicolle yard, which is highly successful at Auteuil, and is partnered by a leading jockey. Nicolle's runners are consistently well-prepared for these conditions and often attract strong market support. No major improvement is required based on stable reputation and typical race placement.

shortlist.name: Muesli (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be prominent in the betting due to top stable and jockey combination.
shortlist.rationale: Also from the Nicolle stable, with Bertrand Lestrade (a top jockey) booked, indicating strong intent. Nicolle often runs multiple live chances in these races, and Lestrade is frequently trusted with leading stable hopes. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Duc De Roche (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be well found in the market given connections and typical stable strength at this venue.
shortlist.rationale: Completes a strong Nicolle trio, with Angelo Zuliani (another top French jumps jockey) in the saddle. The Nicolle/Zuliani partnership is highly effective at Auteuil, and this runner is expected to be competitive without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Koffi Komet (Ger)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market principals due to the Macaire stable's reputation for producing high-class jumpers.
shortlist.rationale: From the Lageneste & Macaire team, who are perennial leading trainers in French jumps racing. Their runners are rarely overlooked in the market at Auteuil, and this horse is likely to be primed for a strong showing. No major improvement required based on connections.

shortlist.name: Kristal Du Seuil (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading French yard with a top jockey booking in Angelo Zuliani, who is often used for stable first-strings. Market support and connections suggest strong expectations. No major negatives on profile.

shortlist.name: Ocre (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Bertrand Lestrade is a top-level jockey at Auteuil and the trainer is respected for producing ready types. Early odds indicate support and no need for major improvement is evident.

shortlist.name: Parfum D'une Reine (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early betting, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a progressive stable with a jockey who rides Auteuil well. Market position and connections point to a strong chance, and no evidence of needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Olympic Story (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the top yard of Francois Nicolle, who is highly respected at Auteuil. Jockey Angelo Zuliani is a leading rider at this venue. Market support suggests strong stable confidence and the connections are known for targeting these races with well-prepared runners.

shortlist.name: Lecoeurdeshommes (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Another Nicolle runner with top jockey James Reveley booked, indicating stable intent. The combination is frequently successful at this level and the horse is not dismissed by the market, suggesting readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: Le Rivage (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early betting; considered a principal contender.
shortlist.rationale: Completes a strong Nicolle trio, all of whom are prominent in the market. The stable often dominates these events and Le Rivage is expected to be competitive based on connections and market signals.

shortlist.name: Maia Kelle (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the Chaille-Chaille stable, a leading name at Auteuil with a strong record in juvenile and novice events. Market support is notable, and connections are highly respected for readying debutants and lightly raced types for this venue.
shortlist.confidence: High—top connections and market strength in a race lacking exposed form.

shortlist.name: Azura De L'abbaye (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Trainer J. Delaunay is a regular source of winners at Auteuil, especially with young horses. Zuliani is a capable jockey with a good strike rate for the yard. Early odds suggest stable confidence.
shortlist.confidence: Solid—trainer/jockey combination is reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Happy Mum's Day (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: E. Grall is a respected trainer with a good record in similar contests. Market position indicates stable confidence, and the booking of Blais is a positive.
shortlist.confidence: Medium to high—connections and market support in a field lacking exposed form.

shortlist.name: Kelibia (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a top jockey at Auteuil and J. Delaunay is a respected trainer at this level. Kelibia is well found in the market, suggesting strong stable confidence and likely readiness. Connections have a strong record in similar contests.

shortlist.name: Khapta (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well supported in early betting, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Kevin Nabet is a leading French jumps jockey and N. de Lageneste is a top trainer, especially with young hurdlers at Auteuil. Market support indicates expectation of a bold run.

shortlist.name: Affortunato (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market, clear market principal.
shortlist.rationale: Angelo Zuliani is a go-to rider for major French yards and S. Dehez is a trainer with a good strike rate in these events. Early odds suggest strong stable confidence and likely ability.

shortlist.name: Henri Quatre (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in current market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections at Auteuil; Francois Nicolle is a leading trainer at this venue and Kevin Nabet is a reliable jockey with strong strike rates in French jumps racing. Market support suggests stable confidence and readiness.

shortlist.name: Golden Park (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-supported in the market, excluded outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Angelo Zuliani is one of France's most consistent jockeys, and M. Seror's runners are regularly competitive at Auteuil. Market position indicates strong chance and connections are in form.

shortlist.name: Heros D'ainay (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: James Reveley is a top international jockey with proven success at Auteuil, and N. de Lageneste is a respected trainer for high-class jumpers. Market support and connections point to a major chance.

shortlist.name: Jet Querari (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.81 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent starts, regularly finishing in the first half of the field. The shortest price in the market, indicating strong support and perceived class edge. Connections are reliable at this level. No evidence of declining form.

shortlist.name: Am Still Winning (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 2.62.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement, with a solid third last time out. Ridden by one of the top jockeys in South Africa, which is a significant positive. Market support is strong and connections are in form.

shortlist.name: Cliffie Clavin (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer, often finishing in the frame. Recent form is solid and the horse is holding condition. Market position suggests respect, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Bandmaster (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has placed in two of last three starts, indicating current form is strong. Odds are competitive and the horse is not an outsider. Connections are capable and the horse is reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Dynalley (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently running in the frame and now faces a field lacking standout recent winners. The current odds indicate strong market confidence. Jockey Maujean is reliable locally, and the horse's recent form figures suggest a solid chance if repeating best efforts.

shortlist.name: Winter Emeralds (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has won recently and is partnered by top jockey Richard Fourie for the powerful Greeff stable. The form shows a recent win and consistent efforts in this grade. Market support is significant, and connections are among the best in the region.

shortlist.name: Blackberry Breeze (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.62 (clear third choice, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level and often runs well at Fairview. Recent form is competitive, and the odds suggest the market expects another solid showing. Habib is a capable jockey, and the horse has placed in similar company.

shortlist.name: Tintamarre (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.01 – clear favorite, extremely short odds.
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, indicating strong current condition and consistency. Top connections and the market's overwhelming support reinforce confidence. No sign of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Baie Mooi (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.24 – strong second favorite, well clear of outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, showing rapid progression and potential for further improvement. Ridden by a leading jockey and trained by a top local trainer. Market support and unexposed profile make this runner a major threat.

shortlist.name: Imaginable (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 1.51 – solidly in the market, not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong with two wins and a third from last three starts, indicating reliability and fitness. Same trainer as the favorite, suggesting stable is in form. Odds reflect genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Forest Spy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last six starts. Trained by G. D. Smith, who also saddles another strong contender, and partnered by a capable jockey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse's reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Golden Pavilion (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form, winning three of last five starts and never finishing out of the top three in that span. Same trainer as Forest Spy, indicating a strong stable presence. Jockey Calvin Habib is experienced and regularly rides winners for this yard. The odds are short, but justified by the horse's consistency and winning profile.

shortlist.name: Kings Again (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 2.02, clear third choice in market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and third last time out suggest the horse is in good form and competitive at this level. Richard Fourie is one of South Africa's top jockeys, and trainer A. C. Greeff is highly respected locally. The odds offer some value given the connections and recent improvement.

shortlist.name: Alex Miller (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in strong recent form, having won two starts back and finished a close second last time. The combination of a top local jockey and trainer adds confidence. The odds reflect strong market support and suggest reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Jambo Sana (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a win and a second in the last two starts, indicating peak form. Connections are respected locally. The odds are fair for a horse with proven recent ability and reliability.

shortlist.name: Augusta Rosso (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently well in higher grade races and now drops in class. Top jockey booking is a positive. Recent form figures show reliability and competitiveness, making this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Exquisite (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and top jockey booking. Trainer is in strong form locally. Odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse has proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Arabian Red (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with a progressive profile and solid connections. Form is reliable and the horse is holding condition well. Stablemate to the favourite, suggesting strong yard representation.

shortlist.name: Bosnay (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in the frame and competitive at this level. Odds indicate market respect and recent runs suggest the horse is capable of making the frame again.

shortlist.name: Red William (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two consecutive wins and strong placed efforts prior. Top local jockey and trainer combination. Odds reflect strong market support and reliability.

shortlist.name: George Handel (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins and solid placed efforts before that. Trainer in good local form. Odds indicate strong market respect.

shortlist.name: Makhachev (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with three consecutive runner-up finishes, suggesting a win is imminent. Trainer and jockey have solid local records. Market support is strong.

shortlist.name: Pardon Me (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.24 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Has a recent win and consistent form in the last five starts, suggesting reliability at this level. The odds indicate strong market confidence, and the connections are solid for this circuit.

shortlist.name: Olive Oyl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win and a second, with a string of consistent placings. Top jockey and trainer combination adds further appeal. The form profile is progressive and reliable.

shortlist.name: Take Your Time (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in the market at 2.12 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistently in the frame, showing solid recent form without needing major improvement. Odds reflect realistic winning chance and the horse is proven at this level.
